intro: Weidmannia tatei, commonly known as the New Zealand rock parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to the cool, temperate climate of its native habitat. Weidmannia tatei is an important component of New Zealand's unique flora and is often found in subalpine and montane regions.
